item.title: Overwatch 2 Launches Porsche Crossover Event
item.description:
Highlights

  • Overwatch 2 launched a new Porsche crossover event on May 14.
  • While the collaboration was initially framed as revolving around an exclusive D.Va costume, Pharah is also getting a unique Legendary Skin as part of the Porsche crossover.
  • Overwatch 2 players can earn more Battle Pass XP and some additional "electric-themed" rewards for the duration of the event.

The Overwatch 2 Porsche crossover event is now live. Blizzard's collaboration with the luxury car brand brings new Legendary Skins and challenges to Overwatch 2 , among several other novelties.

The crossover between Porsche and Overwatch 2 was originally announced in early March 2024. On that occasion, Blizzard said that the themed event would feature an exclusive skin for D.Va. The company followed up on that reveal with a cinematic trailer in early May, which offered fans a glimpse of what this alternate D.Va costume would look like.

Related
Overwatch 2 Hanaoka Map Has a Hidden Room

Some Overwatch 2 fans have discovered an easter egg on the new Hanaoka map in the form of a secret room near one of the spawn locations.

But what the developer has kept under wraps up until recently is that D.Va won't be the only character to get a unique skin out of this unconventional collaboration. Damage hero Pharah is also part of the event, having been treated to an alternate appearance inspired by the Porsche Taycan. Both of these Porsche-themed Legendary Skins can be unlocked in Overwatch 2 starting today , May 14. Game Rant reached out to Blizzard for their pricing information ahead of today's event launch, but did not get any clarification as of press time.

Overwatch 2 Porsche Crossover Event Details

  • New Cosmetics
    • Porsche D.Va Legendary Skin : featuring elements from the electric Porsche Macan Turbo.
    • Porsche Pharah Legendary Skin : featuring elements from the electric Porsche Taycan.

  • Additional Rewards and Challenges
    • Earn 40,000 Battle Pass XP : complete specific challenges during the event to accelerate your Battle Pass progression.
    • Unlock High-Voltage Themed Rewards : engage in the event to earn unique, electric-themed rewards.

Pharah's Porsche Taycan-inspired skin incorporates several elements of the luxury EV, including its unique headlights and taillights. Meanwhile, D.Va's exclusive costume is based on the Porsche Macan Turbo, an electric SUV whose design characteristics were integrated into both her suit and mech. ​​​​​Aside from this duo of Legendary cosmetics, the crossover event also introduces some themed challenges, which allow players to earn up to 40,000 XP that will go toward their Overwatch 2 Season 10 Battle Pass progression . As per usual, the latest iteration of the game's Battle Pass is priced at 1,000 Overwatch Coins, the equivalent of $10.

Porsche Cars That Inspired New Overwatch 2 Legendary Skins

Partaking in the newly introduced Porsche event will also allow players to earn some additional cosmetics. Blizzard was light on the details here, having merely described the limited-time rewards as being "electric-themed."

Looking at the Overwatch 2 Season 10 meta , it is plausible that players will be seeing much more of D.Va's Porsche skin than Pharah's for the duration of the newly launched event. That's largely on account of the former seeing more play than the latter following Blizzard's latest balancing changes to the game. Nevertheless, both D.Va and Pharah are still more than capable of carrying a match. The ongoing season is about halfway done right now, with Blizzard planning to conclude it on June 18. The gaming giant is likely to start sharing some official information about Season 11 even before that date.

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone Get New Update
item.description:
Highlights

  • Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone's newest update expands weapon prestige camos and balances gameplay for a better experience.
  • Changes Modern Warfare 2 weapon prestige camos, JAK Wardens kit fixes, and more improvements.

Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone have received a new update that expands weapon prestige camos, applies some minor weapon-balancing changes, and more. This is likely one of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 's last updates before the launch of Season 4 in late May.

Call of Duty 's last weekly update made various improvements to MW3 's Zombies mode along with bug fixes for certain items, maps, and modes in the game's standard multiplayer. Also, a prevalent Warzone bug causing automatic tactical sprint issues was resolved. That update was followed by another one a day later, which attempted to balance the new JAK Wardens conversion kit that resembles the Model 1887 akimbo shotguns from Modern Warfare 2 (2009).

Related
Call of Duty Zombies Fan Makes Adorable Speed Cola Model Out of Wood

One of Call of Duty's most famous Zombies perk-a-colas comes to life in a much smaller form thanks to a creative fan.

Some of the changes in Call of Duty 's newest update were applied to both Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone , such as weapon prestige camos now being unlockable for MW2 weapons, the JAK Wardens no longer equipping incompatible attachments, the COR-45 no longer firing faster than intended, and various optic attachments now displaying the correct statistics in the Gunsmith menu. Those improvements cover all the Warzone changes, but MW3 received other weapon and equipment adjustments, including a nerf to the DG-58 LSW and a change to the Enhanced Vision Goggles field upgrade, making it no longer automatically unequip after running out of battery. Instead, it now blurs the user's vision upon depletion, allowing a player to unequip the field upgrade at their own convenience.

Other MW3 changes include a bug fix for Derail that prevents players from entering a restricted area and akimbo weapons no longer receiving less reserve ammo than intended in certain scenarios. Small improvements were also applied to a trio of game modes, with EOD Padding in Arcade no longer reducing explosive damage from power weapons, blank perk icons no longer showing on the survivors' HUD in Infected, and weapon stats no longer appearing blank in the after-action report following a One in the Chamber match.

The High-Gain Antenna perk, which was added with Call of Duty 's Season 3 update , also received a minor bug fix that makes enemy equipment correctly display on the user's compass when said equipment is detected by teammates. MW3 's user interface received some upgrades as well, such as equipment skins now able to be previewed in the Store, tracked challenges now accurately reflecting progress towards weapon prestige camos, and more.

That's about it for Call of Duty 's newest update. But as for the future of the series, it seems likely that Call of Duty 2024 will be revealed within the next month or so, either through an in-game reveal that datamined files seemed to hint at, or during Xbox's June showcase on June 9.

Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone Patch Notes for May 14 Update

Multiplayer

UIX

  • Equipment Skins can now be previewed in the Store.
  • Bug Fixes
    • Tracked Challenges widget now accurately reflects progress toward Weapon Prestige Camos.
    • Locked Calling Cards earned via the current Season’s Battle Pass are now displayed in the Customization menu.
    • Locked/Unlocked filter for Calling Cards in the Customization menu now functions as expected.
    • Restored functionality of the Select / Deselect All button in the Quick Play menu.
    • EMP HUD effects no longer persist upon Wheelson-HS destruction via Stormender.

GAMEPLAY

  • Resolved an issue causing Akimbo Weapons to be given less reserve ammo than intended following a map infiltration sequence.

PROGRESSION

  • Weapon Prestige Camos can now be unlocked for MWII Weapons.

MAPS

  • Derail
    • Added collision to prevent an exploit that allowed players to get in the blue train car near the Crossing area.

MODES

  • Arcade
    • EOD Padding no longer reduces incoming explosive damage by power Weapons.

  • Infected
    • Blank Perk icons are no longer shown on the HUD upon spawning as a survivor.

  • One in the Chamber
    • Weapon Match Stats section of the After-Action Report is no longer empty upon completing a match.

WEAPONS & ATTACHMENTS

Light Machine Guns

  • DG-58 LSW
    • Decreased neck, torso, arm, and hand damage multipliers from 1.1x to 1x.

Marksman Rifles

  • Lockwood Mk2
    • JAK Wardens Conversion Kit
      • Resolved an issue causing incompatible Attachments to remain equipped in the Gunsmith.

Handguns

  • COR-45
    • Implemented measures to prevent exploits that allow firing faster than intended.

Attachments

  • Adjusted Pros and Cons for multiple Optic Attachments to reflect their true statistics.
    • Corio Enforcer Optic
    • Dragon’s Eye Optic
    • KR Marauder 9 Riser

PERKS

  • High-Gain Antenna (Gear)
    • Addressed an issue causing Equipment detected by allies with Signal Jammer not to appear indicated on the compass.

EQUIPMENT

  • Scatter Mine (Tactical)
    • In Hardcore mode, players equipped with EOD Padding are no longer immune to stun effects.

FIELD UPGRADES

  • Enhanced Vision Goggles
    • Player is no longer forced to unequip upon a dead battery, instead, vision is blurred until the goggles are manually removed.

EVG battery will not recharge while equipped with a dead battery.

Warzone

PROGRESSION

  • Weapon Prestige Camos can now be unlocked for MWII Weapons.

WEAPONS

MARKSMAN RIFLES

LOCKWOOD MK2 (MWII)

JAK Wardens Conversion Kit

    • Resolved an issue causing incompatible Attachments to remain equipped in the Gunsmith.

HANDGUNS

COR-45

  • Implemented measures to prevent exploits that allow firing faster than intended.

» ATTACHMENTS «

  • Adjusted Pros and Cons for multiple Optic Attachments to reflect their true statistics.
    • Corio Enforcer Optic
    • Dragon’s Eye Optic
    • KR Marauder 9 Riser

item.title: Pokemon Fan Designs Suicune and Milotic Fusion
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon fans love to create unique fusions of their favorite creatures, like Suicune and Milotic, to showcase their creativity.
  • Suicune and Milotic are iconic Water-type Pokemon introduced in different generations, making for interesting fusion possibilities.
  • Fusing Pokemon like Suicune and Milotic allows fans to imagine new creatures with a mix of characteristics from each original monster.

A creative Pokemon fan has recently devised a new creature by fusing the legendary Suicune with Milotic. While fusions are not featured in any mainline Pokemon game, the franchise’s community loves to imagine mixtures of different monsters, and this fan achieved quite an interesting result with this artwork.

Both Suicune and Milotic are Water-type creatures that were introduced in early Pokemon games. Suicune debuted in Pokemon Gold and Silver together with Entei and Raikou as part of the so-called Legendary Beasts trio. Milotic, on the other hand, first appeared in the third generation of the Pokemon franchise as the evolution of Feebas, which could be fished on Route 119.

Related
Pokemon Fan Designs Mega Evolution for Forretress

A talented Pokemon fan devises a new Mega Evolution for Forretress, imagining an alternative version for the Gen 2 Bug/Steel-type creature.

Now, a Pokemon fan called Dodominart has imagined a fusion between Suicune and Milotic. The result of this unnamed Pokemon fusion is a Water-type creature that essentially keeps Suicune’s face and overall colors while adding Milotic’s fish-like body to the design. The Pokemon ends up looking like some sort of seal, as it has dog-like paws in front of it, but a Milotic’s mermaid-inspired tail on its back.

Suicune and Milotic Pokemon Fusion Fan Art

This is not the first time that Suicune appears as part of a fusion in Pokemon fan art, though. Last year, a fan made an amazing fusion of Articuno and Suicune , merging the most iconic characteristics of each legendary Pokemon to come up with a new beast called Articuine. In this artwork, the fused creature had big bird claws but also Suicune’s purple mane.

Milotic has also received some attention from the Pokemon community recently. Last week, another fan came up with a past Paradox form for Milotic named Striking Beauty. This Water/Fighting-type monster resembled a huge sea serpent covered in scales, and it still maintained the most important aspects of Milotic’s design but looked way more powerful than the normal critter. The design came with a shiny variant, which had red, blue, and yellow colors.

In general, Pokemon fusions are quite a popular topic for fan art among the game’s community. Last month, yet another fan of Nintendo’s franchise made an interesting artwork by creating a fusion of the Galarian Ponyta and Rowlet . This design was quite unique, as it resembled a Grass-type Galarian Ponyta that looked like a unicorn covered in leaves. Hopefully, the Pokemon community will keep coming up with interesting fusions that will highlight the most interesting aspects of each Pokemon and amaze the fans of the franchise.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Is Losing 6 Games on May 31
item.description:
Highlights

  • Xbox Game Pass is losing six games at the end of May 2024.
  • The May 31 departures include a few acclaimed indies like Little Witch in the Woods.
  • With 14 total departures and just 12 confirmed new releases, this month is so far shaping up to be a net loss for Xbox Game Pass.

Xbox Game Pass is losing six games at the end of May 2024. The newly announced wave of departures features a varied mixture of genres, and will lead to Xbox Game Pass losing some acclaimed indies such as Little Witch in the Woods .

Microsoft's subscription service lost six games in January, followed by another four in February 2024. It then removed half a dozen titles in March, while 12 more games left its library the following month in a big blow to horror fans with an Xbox Game Pass membership .

Related
Xbox Game Pass Adds Memorable Adventure Classic to Its Catalog of Games Today

Microsoft’s gaming subscription service, Xbox Game Pass, adds a memorable narrative adventure title that is considered a classic by many.

Xbox Game Pass is now set to lose one of its highest-rated titles , Norco , on May 15, along with seven other games. Ahead of that catalog rotation, Microsoft has announced the second wave of this month's outgoings, which is scheduled for May 31. That day will see the service lose Chicory: A Colorful Tale , Farworld Pioneers , Railway Empire 2 , JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure: All-Star Battle R , Little Witch in the Woods , and Pac-Man Museum Plus . The former trio has been part of the Xbox Game Pass library since May 2023, thus being set to have a typical year-long stint on the service.

Xbox Game Pass Games Leaving May 31

Game

Genre

Platform(s)

Added

How Long To Beat

Chicory: A Colorful Tale

Adventure

Cloud, Console, PC

May 2023

9–20 hours

Farworld Pioneers

Sandbox

6–8 hours (achievements only)

JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure: All-Star Battle R

Fighting

January 2023

8–35 hours

Little Witch in the Woods

Life Sim

May 2022

8–12 hours

Pac-Man Museum Plus

Arcade

2–61 hours

Railway Empire 2

Management Sim

May 2023

46–195 hours

Bandai Namco's JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure fighting game had a slightly longer run, which started in January 2023. Meanwhile, Little Witch in the Woods and Pac-Man Museum Plus are now both confirmed to be leaving the service following two-year stints. Achievement hunters with Xbox Game Pass subscriptions could feasibly obtain all of the available Gamerscore points in any one of these outgoing titles before they leave Microsoft's content library. But doing so with more than a few of them is going to be difficult, especially if they are adamant to play through Railway Empire 2 , which is as content-packed as management sims often are.

Xbox Game Pass May Lose More Games Than It Adds in May 2024

As per usual, Microsoft has detailed this latest lineup of departures along with a list of new titles that are set to reach its subscription service over the course of the following two weeks. But with the second wave of May 2024 Xbox Game Pass additions featuring just nine titles, this month is turning out to be a small net loss for its content catalog.

Not accounting for NHL 24 , which technically rolled out in April and is only set to reach Xbox Cloud Gaming this month, May 2024 will see the service add only 12 games, while losing 14 others. At least assuming Microsoft doesn't have some surprise releases up its sleeve, which can never be ruled out.

item.title: PS Plus Premium Adds Free Trial For One of 2020's Most Critically-Acclaimed Games
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fans can now try out The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered for two hours with PS Plus Premium's new free trial option.
  • PS Plus Premium offers a variety of games to enjoy, including free trials that function like full games with trophies and saves.
  • PS Plus Extra and Premium include a wide catalog of PS4 and PS5 games, but titles may leave the service, so subscribers should try them out before they do.

PS Plus Premium has just added a free trial for The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered , the remastered version of one of the most critically acclaimed games of 2020. PS Plus Premium subscribers can test The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered for two hours before deciding whether to keep the game.

PS Plus Premium subscribers have an extensive catalog of games to enjoy while they're available on the service. However, in addition to games, one of the benefits of subscribing to the service is the ability to play trials on some selected titles. Unlike demos, trials function like full games, providing players with trophies and allowing the save from the trial version to be carried over to the purchased game. Many titles that offer trials can be played for one to five hours, letting players experience a game before deciding to invest in it. Recently, Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League joined PS Plus Premium , allowing more players to try out the controversial game.

Related
One PS Plus Free Game for May 2024 Is a Melting Pot of Inspirations

One of May 2024's free PS Plus Essential games was inspired by an unlikely combination of sources, from Metroid to Bloodborne.

And from time to time, the service adds trials of renowned games, as is the case with The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered , now available on PS Plus Premium. Players can test Naughty Dog's acclaimed survival game for two hours before making a decision. It's important to note that this is the remastered version of The Last of Us Part 2 , while the original version remains without a trial. This trial gives fans a chance to decide if it's worth playing the remaster if they already own the original version.

The Last Of Us Part 2 Remastered Game Trial Available

PS Plus Premium is the highest tier of Sony's subscription services. While PS Plus Essentials provides subscribers three, sometimes four, monthly games, PS Plus Extra and Premium have a catalog of PS4 and PS5 games for download. Additionally, the latter allows streaming PS3 games, downloading and playing PS1, PS2, and PSP games, and time-limited trials of various releases. Several of PlayStation's best games have graced the Plus Extra and Premium services.

On the other hand, like most gaming subscription services, the games that make up this catalog have an expiration date. In May, a total of 34 games will leave PS Plus Extra . Among these are several Final Fantasy games, all the Darksiders titles, and even Horizon Zero Dawn: Complete Edition , a Sony first-party title. The advantage of subscription services, like the trial, is that players can try out games while in the catalog, because once they leave, they'll need to purchase them separately.
